Bumps [sass](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass) from 1.24.0 to 1.24.5.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/releases">sass's releases</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>Dart Sass 1.24.5</h2>
<p>To install Dart Sass 1.24.5, download one of the packages above and <a href="https://katiek2.github.io/path-doc/">add it to your PATH</a>, or see <a href="https://sass-lang.com/install">the Sass website</a> for full installation instructions.</p>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<ul>
<li>Highlight contextually-relevant sections of the stylesheet in error messages,   rather than only highlighting the section where the error was detected.</li>
</ul>
<p>See the <a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#1245">full changelog</a> for changes in earlier releases.</p>
<h2>Dart Sass 1.24.4</h2>
<p>To install Dart Sass 1.24.4, download one of the packages above and <a href="https://katiek2.github.io/path-doc/">add it to your PATH</a>, or see <a href="https://sass-lang.com/install">the Sass website</a> for full installation instructions.</p>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<h3>JavaScript API</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug where source map generation would crash with an absolute source map   path and a custom importer that returns string file contents.</li>
</ul>
<p>See the <a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#1244">full changelog</a> for changes in earlier releases.</p>
<h2>Dart Sass 1.24.3</h2>
<p>To install Dart Sass 1.24.3, download one of the packages above and <a href="https://katiek2.github.io/path-doc/">add it to your PATH</a>, or see <a href="https://sass-lang.com/install">the Sass website</a> for full installation instructions.</p>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug where <code>sass --version</code> would crash for certain executable   distributions.</li>
</ul>
<p>See the <a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#1243">full changelog</a> for changes in earlier releases.</p>
<h2>Dart Sass 1.24.2</h2>
<p>To install Dart Sass 1.24.2, download one of the packages above and <a href="https://katiek2.github.io/path-doc/">add it to your PATH</a>, or see <a href="https://sass-lang.com/install">the Sass website</a> for full installation instructions.</p>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug introduced in the previous release that prevented custom importers   in Node.js from loading import-only files.</li>
</ul>
<p>See the <a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#1242">full changelog</a> for changes in earlier releases.</p>
<h2>Dart Sass 1.24.1</h2>
<p>To install Dart Sass 1.24.1, download one of the packages above and <a href="https://katiek2.github.io/path-doc/">add it to your PATH</a>, or see <a href="https://sass-lang.com/install">the Sass website</a> for full installation instructions.</p>
<h2>Changes</h2>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug where the wrong file could be loaded when the same URL is used by   both a <code>@use</code> rule and an <code>@import</code> rule.</li>
</ul>
<p>See the <a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#1241">full changelog</a> for changes in earlier releases.</p>
</blockquote>
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md">sass's changelog</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>1.24.5</h2>
<ul>
<li>Highlight contextually-relevant sections of the stylesheet in error messages,
rather than only highlighting the section where the error was detected.</li>
</ul>
<h2>1.24.4</h2>
<h3>JavaScript API</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug where source map generation would crash with an absolute source map
path and a custom importer that returns string file contents.</li>
</ul>
<h2>1.24.3</h2>
<h3>Command Line Interface</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug where <code>sass --version</code> would crash for certain executable
distributions.</li>
</ul>
<h2>1.24.2</h2>
<h3>JavaScript API</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug introduced in the previous release that prevented custom importers
in Node.js from loading import-only files.</li>
</ul>
<h2>1.24.1</h2>
<ul>
<li>Fix a bug where the wrong file could be loaded when the same URL is used by
both a <code>@use</code> rule and an <code>@import</code> rule.</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/5e29ea63be4997154695b73e52b81d07e6e5dd61"><code>5e29ea6</code></a> Merge pull request <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sass/dart-sass/issues/935">#935</a> from sass/release</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/7ddd7563ca16ee385851d5732801bfc30db07da9"><code>7ddd756</code></a> Add a test case to verify that the pubspec version is bumped</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/99c58029d8b2c2fc269de724287c67646ac5ce0a"><code>99c5802</code></a> Bump the pubspec version</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/1fd8eb1a8d22ca7f2708dd790dc5f7463d62f964"><code>1fd8eb1</code></a> Merge pull request <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sass/dart-sass/issues/926">#926</a> from sass/multi-span</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/e4db19be3ff7b5f704b79bb320538a226f1453e7"><code>e4db19b</code></a> Resynchronize</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/aa18e65f57fe5e4972ae76aca4148f392e071933"><code>aa18e65</code></a> Code review</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/5957a5771f569f996f0dbcb4000cbf39d9d61898"><code>5957a57</code></a> Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into multi-span</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/9f2b75b013a71f46860d7d30a493d8973df35b14"><code>9f2b75b</code></a> Merge pull request <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/sass/dart-sass/issues/931">#931</a> from sass/no-node-on-dev</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/a148c5c366c3a0a9c662d2b4af05c68e4c9e7856"><code>a148c5c</code></a> Skip Node tests on Dart dev until <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/dart-lang/sdk/issues/40152">dart-lang/sdk#40152</a> is fixed</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/commit/6118ded4b241c38882a4863c8d9b37cb3bc9f56e"><code>6118ded</code></a> Don't upgrade source_span to avoid formatting changes</li>
<li>Additional commits viewable in <a href="https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.24.0...1.24.5">compare view</a></li>
</ul>
</details>
<br />


[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=sass&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=1.24.0&new-version=1.24.5)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=sass&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=1.24.0&new-version=1.24.5)

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.

[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start)
[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end)

---

<details>
<summary>Dependabot commands and options</summary>
<br />

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:
- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR
- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed
- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme

Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com):
- Update frequency (including time of day and day of week)
- Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time)
- Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies)
- Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired)
- Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)



</details>
Bumps [filp/whoops](https://github.com/filp/whoops) from 2.7.0 to 2.7.1.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/filp/whoops/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md">filp/whoops's changelog</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h1>2.7.1</h1>
<ul>
<li>Fix a PHP warning in some cases with anonymous classes.</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/filp/whoops/commit/fff6f1e4f36be0e0d0b84d66b413d9dcb0c49130"><code>fff6f1e</code></a> Changelog for 2.7.1</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/filp/whoops/commit/66c39bf6675c4a26837337b7af1162f27e95ae08"><code>66c39bf</code></a> Merge pull request <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/filp/whoops/issues/657">#657</a> from takamichi/fix-pretty-page-handler</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/filp/whoops/commit/b21e7c9c210847dd7263dd99693b3ad3cfcf7319"><code>b21e7c9</code></a> fix anonymous class dumping</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/filp/whoops/commit/c09b64303eda6ced6e28c32c1bddbdd971aeb019"><code>c09b643</code></a> Fix getFileLines comment, fixup 8338e582</li>
<li>See full diff in <a href="https://github.com/filp/whoops/compare/2.7.0...2.7.1">compare view</a></li>
</ul>
</details>

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.

[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start)
[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end)

---

<details>
<summary>Dependabot commands and options</summary>
<br />

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:
- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR
- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed
- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme

Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com):
- Update frequency (including time of day and day of week)
- Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time)
- Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies)
- Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired)
- Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)



</details>
Bumps [@babel/plugin-syntax-dynamic-import](https://github.com/babel/babel) from 7.7.4 to 7.8.3.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/babel/babel/releases">@babel/plugin-syntax-dynamic-import's releases</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>v7.8.3 (2020-01-13)</h2>
<h4>:bug: Bug Fix</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-types</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/11002">#11002</a> fix: generated builder parameter should respect builder keys (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>:house: Internal</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-preset-env-standalone</code>, <code>babel-standalone</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10994">#10994</a> Ignore .map files in standalone packages (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>babel-plugin-proposal-decorators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-dynamic-import</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-logical-assignment-operators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-async-generators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-bigint</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-dynamic-import</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-json-strings</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-nullish-coalescing-operator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-object-rest-spread</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-optional-catch-binding</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-optional-chaining</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-flow-strip-types</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-modules-systemjs</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-constant-elements</code>, <code>babel-preset-env-standalone</code>, <code>babel-preset-env</code>, <code>babel-standalone</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10820">#10820</a> Archive syntax plugins enabled by default (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>:leftwards_arrow_with_hook: Revert</h4>
<ul>
<li><em>Every package</em>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/11003">#11003</a> Revert &quot;chore: specify package type (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/issues/10849">#10849</a>)&quot; (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>Committers: 2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Huáng Jùnliàng (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li>Nicolò Ribaudo (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h2>v7.8.2 (2020-01-12)</h2>
<h4>:bug: Bug Fix</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-preset-env</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10992">#10992</a> fix: <code>isPluginRequired</code> returns the opposite result in v7.8.0 (<a href="https://github.com/sodatea">@sodatea</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>Committers: 1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Haoqun Jiang (<a href="https://github.com/sodatea">@sodatea</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h2>v7.8.1 (2020-01-12)</h2>
<h4>:bug: Bug Fix</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-compat-data</code>, <code>babel-helper-compilation-targets</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10991">#10991</a> Downgrade semver for compatibility with Node 6 (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>Committers: 1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Nicolò Ribaudo (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h2>v7.8.0 (2020-01-12)</h2>
<p>Blog post <a href="https://babeljs.io/blog/2020/01/11/7.8.0">on the website</a></p>
<h4>:eyeglasses: Spec Compliance</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-parser</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10980">#10980</a> Disallow private name in object elements and TS type elements (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10955">#10955</a> LiteralPropertyName should allow BigIntLiteral (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10953">#10953</a> fix: check await when parsing AsyncArrowBindingIdentifier (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10947">#10947</a> Fix: TopLevelAwait should respect await identifiers defined in sub scope. (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10946">#10946</a> fix: Class Field Initializer should not allow await expression as immediate child (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>babel-plugin-proposal-numeric-separator</code></li>
</ul>
</tr></table> ... (truncated)
</blockquote>
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md">@babel/plugin-syntax-dynamic-import's changelog</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>v7.8.3 (2020-01-13)</h2>
<h4>:bug: Bug Fix</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-types</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/11002">#11002</a> fix: generated builder parameter should respect builder keys (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>:house: Internal</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-preset-env-standalone</code>, <code>babel-standalone</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10994">#10994</a> Ignore .map files in standalone packages (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>babel-plugin-proposal-decorators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-dynamic-import</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-logical-assignment-operators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-async-generators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-bigint</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-dynamic-import</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-json-strings</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-nullish-coalescing-operator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-object-rest-spread</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-optional-catch-binding</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-optional-chaining</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-flow-strip-types</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-modules-systemjs</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-constant-elements</code>, <code>babel-preset-env-standalone</code>, <code>babel-preset-env</code>, <code>babel-standalone</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10820">#10820</a> Archive syntax plugins enabled by default (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>:leftwards_arrow_with_hook: Revert</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-cli</code>, <code>babel-code-frame</code>, <code>babel-core</code>, <code>babel-generator</code>, <code>babel-helper-annotate-as-pure</code>, <code>babel-helper-bindify-decorators</code>, <code>babel-helper-builder-binary-assignment-operator-visitor</code>, <code>babel-helper-builder-react-jsx</code>, <code>babel-helper-call-delegate</code>, <code>babel-helper-compilation-targets</code>, <code>babel-helper-create-class-features-plugin</code>, <code>babel-helper-create-regexp-features-plugin</code>, <code>babel-helper-define-map</code>, <code>babel-helper-explode-assignable-expression</code>, <code>babel-helper-explode-class</code>, <code>babel-helper-fixtures</code>, <code>babel-helper-function-name</code>, <code>babel-helper-get-function-arity</code>, <code>babel-helper-hoist-variables</code>, <code>babel-helper-member-expression-to-functions</code>, <code>babel-helper-module-imports</code>, <code>babel-helper-module-transforms</code>, <code>babel-helper-optimise-call-expression</code>, <code>babel-helper-plugin-test-runner</code>, <code>babel-helper-plugin-utils</code>, <code>babel-helper-regex</code>, <code>babel-helper-remap-async-to-generator</code>, <code>babel-helper-replace-supers</code>, <code>babel-helper-simple-access</code>, <code>babel-helper-split-export-declaration</code>, <code>babel-helper-transform-fixture-test-runner</code>, <code>babel-helper-wrap-function</code>, <code>babel-helpers</code>, <code>babel-highlight</code>, <code>babel-node</code>, <code>babel-parser</code>, <code>babel-plugin-external-helpers</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-async-generator-functions</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-class-properties</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-decorators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-do-expressions</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-dynamic-import</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-export-default-from</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-export-namespace-from</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-function-bind</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-function-sent</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-json-strings</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-logical-assignment-operators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-nullish-coalescing-operator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-numeric-separator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-optional-catch-binding</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-optional-chaining</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-partial-application</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-pipeline-operator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-private-methods</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-throw-expressions</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-unicode-property-regex</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-class-properties</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-decorators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-do-expressions</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-export-default-from</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-export-namespace-from</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-flow</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-function-bind</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-function-sent</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-import-meta</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-jsx</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-logical-assignment-operators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-numeric-separator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-partial-application</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-pipeline-operator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-throw-expressions</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-top-level-await</code>, <code>babel-plugin-syntax-typescript</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-arrow-functions</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-async-to-generator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-block-scoped-functions</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-block-scoping</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-classes</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-computed-properties</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-destructuring</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-dotall-regex</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-duplicate-keys</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-exponentiation-operator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-flow-comments</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-flow-strip-types</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-for-of</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-function-name</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-instanceof</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-jscript</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-literals</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-member-expression-literals</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-modules-amd</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-modules-systemjs</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-modules-umd</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-named-capturing-groups-regex</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-new-target</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-object-assign</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-object-set-prototype-of-to-assign</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-object-super</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-parameters</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-property-literals</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-property-mutators</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-proto-to-assign</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-constant-elements</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-display-name</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-inline-elements</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-jsx-compat</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-jsx-self</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-jsx-source</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-react-jsx</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-regenerator</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-reserved-words</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-runtime</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-shorthand-properties</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-spread</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-sticky-regex</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-strict-mode</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-template-literals</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-typeof-symbol</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-typescript</code>, <code>babel-plugin-transform-unicode-regex</code>, <code>babel-polyfill</code>, <code>babel-preset-env</code>, <code>babel-preset-flow</code>, <code>babel-preset-react</code>, <code>babel-preset-stage-0</code>, <code>babel-preset-stage-1</code>, <code>babel-preset-stage-2</code>, <code>babel-preset-stage-3</code>, <code>babel-preset-typescript</code>, <code>babel-register</code>, <code>babel-runtime-corejs2</code>, <code>babel-runtime-corejs3</code>, <code>babel-runtime</code>, <code>babel-template</code>, <code>babel-traverse</code>, <code>babel-types</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/11003">#11003</a> Revert &quot;chore: specify package type (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/issues/10849">#10849</a>)&quot; (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2>v7.8.2 (2020-01-12)</h2>
<h4>:bug: Bug Fix</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-preset-env</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10992">#10992</a> fix: <code>isPluginRequired</code> returns the opposite result in v7.8.0 (<a href="https://github.com/sodatea">@sodatea</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2>v7.8.1 (2020-01-12)</h2>
<h4>:bug: Bug Fix</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-compat-data</code>, <code>babel-helper-compilation-targets</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10991">#10991</a> Downgrade semver for compatibility with Node 6 (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h2>v7.8.0 (2020-01-12)</h2>
<h4>:eyeglasses: Spec Compliance</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-parser</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10980">#10980</a> Disallow private name in object elements and TS type elements (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10955">#10955</a> LiteralPropertyName should allow BigIntLiteral (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10953">#10953</a> fix: check await when parsing AsyncArrowBindingIdentifier (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10947">#10947</a> Fix: TopLevelAwait should respect await identifiers defined in sub scope. (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10946">#10946</a> fix: Class Field Initializer should not allow await expression as immediate child (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>babel-plugin-proposal-numeric-separator</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10938">#10938</a> StringNumericLiteral does not include NumericLiteralSeparator (<a href="https://github.com/JLHwung">@JLHwung</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>babel-generator</code>, <code>babel-parser</code>, <code>babel-plugin-proposal-private-methods</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10456">#10456</a> [parser] Disallow duplicate and undeclared private names (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>:boom: Breaking Change</h4>
<ul>
<li><code>babel-types</code>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10917">#10917</a> (opt-in) Improve @babel/types with env.BABEL_TYPES_8_BREAKING (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

</ul>
</li>
<li><code>babel-core</code>
<ul>

<li><a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/babel/babel/pull/10903">#10903</a> Add support for babel.config.mjs and .babelrc.mjs (<a href="https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo">@nicolo-ribaudo</a>)</li>
</ul>

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=@babel/plugin-syntax-dynamic-import&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=7.7.4&new-version=7.8.3)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=@babel/plugin-syntax-dynamic-import&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=7.7.4&new-version=7.8.3)

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.

[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start)
[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end)

---

<details>
<summary>Dependabot commands and options</summary>
<br />

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:
- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR
- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed
- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme

Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com):
- Update frequency (including time of day and day of week)
- Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time)
- Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies)
- Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired)
- Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)



</details>
Bumps [stylelint](https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint) from 12.0.1 to 13.0.0.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/releases">stylelint's releases</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>13.0.0</h2>
<ul>
<li>Removed: Node.js 8.x support. Node.js 10 is now required. We can guarantee stylelint works on the latest Node.js 10 release. (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4500">#4500</a>).</li>
<li>Removed: types declarations for Flow (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4451">#4451</a>).</li>
<li>Changed: <code>globby</code> was updated to v10. Now only forward-slashes (<code>/</code>) should be used as directory separator in globs. Refer to <a href="https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob#pattern-syntax">glob pattern syntax</a>. Most of the users wouldn't need to change anything, but Windows users might need to update their globs. (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4254">#4254</a>).</li>
<li>Added: <code>unit-no-unknown</code> support for <code>x</code> unit (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4427">#4427</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>--report-invalid-scope-disables</code> crash when no rules specified (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4498">#4498</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>media-feature-parentheses-space-inside</code> false negatives for multiple spaces (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4513">#4513</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>selector-type-no-unknown</code> false positives for SVG tags (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4495">#4495</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>unit-no-unknown</code> false positives for Sass map keys (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4450">#4450</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>value-list-comma-newline-after</code> false positives for shared-line comments (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4482">#4482</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: consistently check that selectors are standard before passing to the parser (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4483">#4483</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: overlapping disabled ranges edge case (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4497">#4497</a>).</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md">stylelint's changelog</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>13.0.0</h2>
<ul>
<li>Removed: Node.js 8.x support. Node.js 10 is now required. We can guarantee stylelint works on the latest Node.js 10 release. (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4500">#4500</a>).</li>
<li>Removed: types declarations for Flow (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4451">#4451</a>).</li>
<li>Changed: <code>globby</code> was updated to v10. Now only forward-slashes (<code>/</code>) should be used as directory separator in globs. Refer to <a href="https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob#pattern-syntax">glob pattern syntax</a>. Most of the users wouldn't need to change anything, but Windows users might need to update their globs. (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4254">#4254</a>).</li>
<li>Added: <code>unit-no-unknown</code> support for <code>x</code> unit (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4427">#4427</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>--report-invalid-scope-disables</code> crash when no rules specified (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4498">#4498</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>media-feature-parentheses-space-inside</code> false negatives for multiple spaces (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4513">#4513</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>selector-type-no-unknown</code> false positives for SVG tags (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4495">#4495</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>unit-no-unknown</code> false positives for Sass map keys (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4450">#4450</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: <code>value-list-comma-newline-after</code> false positives for shared-line comments (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4482">#4482</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: consistently check that selectors are standard before passing to the parser (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4483">#4483</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed: overlapping disabled ranges edge case (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/pull/4497">#4497</a>).</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
</details>
<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>
<ul>

<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/704f6a23db7d6c81e5f43494da6c0af7de7a846a"><code>704f6a2</code></a> Prepare 13.0.0</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/50ba8a9da035af15c437df85a6df7e8615760d2d"><code>50ba8a9</code></a> Reorder changelog</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/1666bba8764c85f034de9a7801b7fb0eeb09e055"><code>1666bba</code></a> Update devDependencies (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/issues/4542">#4542</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/062d2986186b0ac027e6a672996e72eee9f07ae1"><code>062d298</code></a> Reindent nodejs.yml (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/issues/4541">#4541</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/a24e44aa2ed6d3ffbc9b435533f83bce6e021286"><code>a24e44a</code></a> Fix atypical rule README structure (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/issues/4537">#4537</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/616ad71a56515aeb04dd81c614e60809ab74d3c6"><code>616ad71</code></a> Bump husky from 4.0.3 to 4.0.6 (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/issues/4536">#4536</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/5e58ee7191b51ed661a40435bf873af358b21427"><code>5e58ee7</code></a> Bump globby from 10.0.2 to 11.0.0 (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/issues/4528">#4528</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/eaee6a4f5860ba5c83cc2ba3af0d5a20813278c5"><code>eaee6a4</code></a> Refactor CLI options definition (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/stylelint/stylelint/issues/4530">#4530</a>)</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/commit/6a2ffbd73fd95438e6c0ed65c37c98088bf97f07"><code>6a2ffbd</code></a> Fix plugin path</li>
<li>Additional commits viewable in <a href="https://github.com/stylelint/stylelint/compare/12.0.1...13.0.0">compare view</a></li>
</ul>
</details>
<br />


[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=stylelint&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=12.0.1&new-version=13.0.0)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=stylelint&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=12.0.1&new-version=13.0.0)

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.

[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start)
[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end)

---

<details>
<summary>Dependabot commands and options</summary>
<br />

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:
- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR
- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed
- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme

Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com):
- Update frequency (including time of day and day of week)
- Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time)
- Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies)
- Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired)
- Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)



</details>
Bumps [eslint-plugin-import](https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import) from 2.19.1 to 2.20.0.
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md">eslint-plugin-import's changelog</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>[2.20.0] - 2020-01-10</h2>
<h3>Added</h3>
<ul>
<li>[<code>order</code>]: added <code>caseInsensitive</code> as an additional option to <code>alphabetize</code> (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1586">#1586</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/dbrewer5">@dbrewer5</a>])</li>
<li>[<code>no-restricted-paths</code>]: New <code>except</code> option per <code>zone</code>, allowing exceptions to be defined for a restricted zone (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1238">#1238</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/rsolomon">@rsolomon</a>])</li>
</ul>
<h3>Fixed</h3>
<ul>
<li>[<code>no-unused-modules</code>]: fix usage of <code>import/extensions</code> settings (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1560">#1560</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/stekycz">@stekycz</a>])</li>
<li>[<code>import/extensions</code>]: ignore non-main modules (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1563">#1563</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/saschanaz">@saschanaz</a>])</li>
<li>TypeScript config: lookup for external modules in <a href="https://github.com/types">@types</a> folder (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1526">#1526</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/joaovieira">@joaovieira</a>])</li>
<li>[<code>no-extraneous-dependencies</code>]: ensure <code>node.source</code> is truthy (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1589">#1589</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/ljharb">@ljharb</a>])</li>
<li>[<code>extensions</code>]: Ignore query strings when checking for extensions (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1572">#1572</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/pcorpet">@pcorpet</a>])</li>
</ul>
<h3>Docs</h3>
<ul>
<li>[<code>extensions</code>]: improve <code>ignorePackages</code> docs (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1248">#1248</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/ivo-stefchev">@ivo-stefchev</a>])</li>
</ul>
<h3>Added</h3>
<ul>
<li>[<code>order</code>]: add option pathGroupsExcludedImportTypes to allow ordering of external import types (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/1565">#1565</a>, thanks [<a href="https://github.com/Mairu">@Mairu</a>])</li>
</ul>
</blockquote>
</details>

<li><a href="https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/commit/b9459f0ea3bc6a24f73276d5bd52651a606f965b"><code>b9459f0</code></a> resolvers/node: v0.3.3</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/commit/24ce28df2c5991e52e99c27b9dd9c855478862a4"><code>24ce28d</code></a> utils: v2.5.1</li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/commit/25895d7de4d6b8dbc0dd21f85fea62404f560315"><code>25895d7</code></a> [memo-parser] v0.2.1</li>

<li><a href="https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/commit/fb0cbebf02cb2b00383cc044129c1ac852c513af"><code>fb0cbeb</code></a> utils: Uses createRequireFromPath to resolve loaders</li>

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.

[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start)
[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end)

---

<details>
<summary>Dependabot commands and options</summary>
<br />

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:
- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR
- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed
- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme

Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com):
- Update frequency (including time of day and day of week)
- Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time)
- Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies)
- Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired)
- Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)



</details>
Bumps [sass-loader](https://github.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader) from 8.0.0 to 8.0.2.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/releases">sass-loader's releases</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>v8.0.2</h2>
<h3><a href="https://github.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/compare/v8.0.1...v8.0.2">8.0.2</a> (2020-01-13)</h3>
<h3>Bug Fixes</h3>
<ul>
<li>compatibility with node@8 (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/issues/798">#798</a>) (<a href="https://github.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/commit/6f3852f7d393dd0bc8f8d264d81ecc941bc72511">6f3852f</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h2>v8.0.1</h2>
<h3><a href="https://github.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/compare/v8.0.0...v8.0.1">8.0.1</a> (2020-01-10)</h3>
<h3>Bug Fixes</h3>
<ul>
<li>support webpack@5 (<a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/issues/794">#794</a>) (<a href="https://github.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/commit/6c59e37e3f67668d7a3908444ddfc0176bc5601f">6c59e37</a>)</li>

</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>

<summary>Dependabot commands and options</summary>
<br />

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:
- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR
- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed
- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language

Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com):

- Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time)
- Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies)

Bumps [@wordpress/babel-preset-default](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/babel-preset-default) from 4.8.0 to 4.9.0.
<details>
<summary>Release notes</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/releases">@wordpress/babel-preset-default's releases</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<h2>4.9.0</h2>
<h1>Changelog</h1>
<h2>Performance</h2>
<ul>
<li>Implement an async rendering mode for the data module updates.</li>
<li>Avoid rerendering the block components when selecting a block.</li>
<li>Improve the performance of isEditorEmptyPost selector (13% typing performance improvement).</li>
<li>Data Module: Avoid persisting unchanged values.</li>
<li>Update withSelect to use type-optimized isShallowEqual.</li>
<li>Move data selection to event handlers (called only when necessary).</li>
<li>Improve the initial rendering time by optimizing the withFilters Higher-order component.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Bug Fixes</h2>
<ul>
<li>Fix RichText toolbar when using multiline=”li”.</li>
<li>Correct the margin of the block icons in the inserter.</li>
<li>Fix ampersand in post tags causing editor crash.</li>
<li>Remove alignundefined class from gallery block edit markup.</li>
<li>Disable the button to open the publish sidebar if locked.</li>
<li>Correct the default margin for buttons with icons.</li>
<li>Keep the date floating when for posts with &quot;pending&quot; status.</li>
<li>Fix using the EXIF title when uploading images.</li>
<li>Fix font size picker on mobile.</li>
<li>Fix z-index of the Reusable Block Inserter button.</li>
<li>Fix autop behavior when a text is followed by a div.</li>
<li>Fix warning when returning null from a data module generator.</li>
<li>Announce the screen reader messages in the correct order in Safari.</li>
<li>Check Post Type support in the options modal.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Enhancements</h2>
<ul>
<li>Support customizing the table background colors.</li>
<li>Support underlining text using the keyboard shortcut ctrl+U.</li>
<li>Apply the editor styles to the HTML Block Preview.</li>
<li>Improve the color swatch selection indicator.</li>
<li>Improve scrolling behavior in Fullscreen Mode in Edge.</li>
<li>Remove deprecated embed providers.</li>
<li>Refactor the alignements support in the Cover Block and the Categories Block.</li>
<li>Code quality improvement to getBlockContentSchema</li>
<li>Internationalize the excerpt documentation link.</li>
<li>Improve pasting of quotes with citations.</li>
<li>A11y
<ul>
<li>Add a tooltip to the block list appender.</li>
<li>Improve the color contrast of the inserter shortcuts.</li>
<li>Remove the label from the Warning component’s menu.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Add an option to overwrite the block in the Warning component.</li>
</ul>
<h2>Extensibility</h2>
<ul>
<li>Support custom fetch handlers for wp.apiFetch.</li>
<li>Support additional data passed to the mediaUpload utility.</li>
<li>Add filter for the preview interstitial markup.</li>
<li>Avoid appending empty query string in wp.url.addQueryArgs.</li>
</ul>
</tr></table> ... (truncated)
</blockquote>
</details>
<details>
<summary>Changelog</summary>
<p><em>Sourced from <a href="https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/blob/master/changelog.txt">@wordpress/babel-preset-default's changelog</a>.</em></p>
<blockquote>
<p>== Changelog ==</p>
<p>= 7.2.0 =</p>
<h3>New Features</h3>
<ul>
<li>Add a new Buttons block. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/17352">#17352</a></li>
<li>Support adding links to Media &amp; Text block image. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/18139">#18139</a></li>
<li>Navigation block: Support changing the font size. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19127">#19127</a></li>
<li>Gallery block: Add images size selector. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/18581">#18581</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Enhancements</h3>
<ul>
<li>Improve the block inserter search algorithm. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19122">#19122</a></li>
<li>Improve the block placeholders design and responsiveness. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/18745">#18745</a></li>
<li>Navigation mode: Auto-enable when tabbing to the block list with an existing block selection. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19238">#19238</a> <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19298">#19298</a></li>
<li>Use tabs for gradient and color. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19133">#19133</a></li>
<li>Add &quot;download&quot; keyword to the File block. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/18995">#18995</a></li>
<li>Add &quot;poem&quot; keyword to the Verse block. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19355">#19355</a></li>
<li>Convert to blocks:
<ul>
<li>preserve text alignment. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19097">#19097</a></li>
<li>Skip shortcode if not on its own line. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19059">#19059</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Writing flow: Improve tabbing for Edit mode. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19235">#19235</a></li>
<li>Use Popover for the block toolbar. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/18779">#18779</a></li>
<li>Improve the block multi-selection styles. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19094">#19094</a> <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19121">#19121</a></li>
<li>Support reduced-motion for Social Links transitions. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/18750">#18750</a></li>
<li>Use the default cursor for Select Tool <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19157">#19157</a></li>
<li>Round position attributes on cover focal point save. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19183">#19183</a></li>
<li>Remove block inserter shortcuts. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19045">#19045</a></li>
<li>Navigation block:
<ul>
<li>Clarify the placeholder label. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19105">#19105</a></li>
<li>Removes the reusable block option from the items. <a href="https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wordpress/gutenberg/pull/19250">#19250</a></li>

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.

<details>
<summary>Dependabot commands and options</summary>
<br />

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:
- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR
- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed
- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
- `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language
- `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme

Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com):
- Update frequency (including time of day and day of week)
- Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time)
- Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies)
- Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired)
- Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)



</details>
See #2370 

I know sage has always registered the scripts at the same time they're enqueued so this solution might not be great to everyone.

Another option is to somehow fix it in the laravel mix config I guess.
* [x] I've read the [guidelines for Contributing to Roots Projects](https://github.com/roots/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
* [x] This request isn't a duplicate of an existing issue
* [x] I've read the [docs](https://roots.io/documentation/) and followed them (if applicable)
* [x] This is not a personal support request that should be posted on the [Roots Discourse](https://discourse.roots.io/) community

## Description

Not sure when this happened as it runs fine on an older site based on sage 10.0.0-dev. Anyways as title says, using ES6 classes causes `editor.js` to not execute. Using es6 classes in `app.js` works fine. Check _Additional information_ further down for some initial debugging.

## Steps to reproduce

1. Add the following to the `editor.js` file:

    ```js
    class Foobar {}
    console.log('test');
    ```

2. Run `npm run build`
3. Edit a page with the block editor and open the console

**Expected behavior:** See `test` logged in the console

**Actual behavior:** Nothing is logged.

**Reproduces how often:** Always

## Versions

Sage: 10.0.0-dev branch
Node v12.12.0 (same on 10.17.0)

## Additional information

I dug a bit and turns out this is caused by [`@wordpress/babel-preset-default`](https://github.com/kellymears/laravel-mix-wp-blocks/) which is added to laravel mix thorugh [`laravel-mix-wp-block`](https://github.com/kellymears/laravel-mix-wp-blocks/)

- If I remove the babel preset, the console command runs.
- If I add the class to `app.js` instead, the console command runs.

When inspecting the difference of the compiled files I noticed that `@wordpress/babel-preset-default` seem to [replace inlined babel runtime helpers](https://babeljs.io/docs/en/babel-plugin-transform-runtime#helpers) unlike the default laravel mix `.js()` command. Not sure if this is the cause though.

### Without `@wordpress/babel-preset-default` (works)

```js
"use strict";
__webpack_require__.r(__webpack_exports__);
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_edit_post__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__ = __webpack_require__(/*! @wordpress/edit-post */ "@wordpress/edit-post");
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_edit_post__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0___default = /*#__PURE__*/__webpack_require__.n(_wordpress_edit_post__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__);
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_dom_ready__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_1__ = __webpack_require__(/*! @wordpress/dom-ready */ "@wordpress/dom-ready");
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_dom_ready__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_1___default = /*#__PURE__*/__webpack_require__.n(_wordpress_dom_ready__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_1__);
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_blocks__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_2__ = __webpack_require__(/*! @wordpress/blocks */ "@wordpress/blocks");
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_blocks__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_2___default = /*#__PURE__*/__webpack_require__.n(_wordpress_blocks__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_2__);
function _classCallCheck(instance, Constructor) {
  if (!(instance instanceof Constructor)) {
    throw new TypeError("Cannot call a class as a function");
  }
}





var Foobar = function Foobar() {
  _classCallCheck(this, Foobar);
};

console.log('test');
```

### With `@wordpress/babel-preset-default` (does not work)

```js
"use strict";
__webpack_require__.r(__webpack_exports__);
/* harmony import */ var _babel_runtime_helpers_classCallCheck__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__ = __webpack_require__(/*! @babel/runtime/helpers/classCallCheck */ "./node_modules/@babel/runtime/helpers/classCallCheck.js");
/* harmony import */ var _babel_runtime_helpers_classCallCheck__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0___default = /*#__PURE__*/__webpack_require__.n(_babel_runtime_helpers_classCallCheck__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__);
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_edit_post__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_1__ = __webpack_require__(/*! @wordpress/edit-post */ "@wordpress/edit-post");
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_edit_post__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_1___default = /*#__PURE__*/__webpack_require__.n(_wordpress_edit_post__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_1__);
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_dom_ready__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_2__ = __webpack_require__(/*! @wordpress/dom-ready */ "@wordpress/dom-ready");
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_dom_ready__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_2___default = /*#__PURE__*/__webpack_require__.n(_wordpress_dom_ready__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_2__);
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_blocks__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_3__ = __webpack_require__(/*! @wordpress/blocks */ "@wordpress/blocks");
/* harmony import */ var _wordpress_blocks__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_3___default = /*#__PURE__*/__webpack_require__.n(_wordpress_blocks__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_3__);





var Foobar = function Foobar() {
  _babel_runtime_helpers_classCallCheck__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0___default()(this, Foobar);
};

console.log('test');
```

I'll look into this more at a later point but would be good to know if others can reproduce as well. Someone with more insight into webpack internals might understand this better too.

I tried installing a fresh copy of Sage yesterday and got an error after running `yarn`. [Sage docs](https://roots.io/sage/docs/existing-sage-projects/), recommend using NodeJS LTS which is currently v12. The [minimum node-sass version](https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-sass) for Node 12 is now node-sass 4.12+. Error output attached.

[node-sass.txt](https://github.com/roots/sage/files/3998983/node-sass.txt)
